atlantis.framework

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • atlantis.framework.Matrix

  • public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
    A matrix 4x4 Some methods has been ported from the open source project SharpDX. Check this project here : https://github.com/sharpdx/SharpDX
    Author:
    Yannick

      • Matrix

        public Matrix(float[] values)
       throws java.lang.Exception
        Create a matrix with an array of 16 values.
        Parameters:
        values - An array of 16 float values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the array hasn't 16 values.

      • createPerspectiveFieldOfView

        public static Matrix createPerspectiveFieldOfView(float fov,
                                  float aspect,
                                  float zNear,
                                  float zFar)
        Create a perspective field of view matrix with Left hand notation.
        Parameters:
        fov - Desired field of view (Math.PI / 4 is a good value)
        aspect - Desired aspect ratio (Screen width / height)
        near - Near clip
        far - Far clip
        Returns:
        Return a matrix of this type of perspective.

      • createPerspetiveFieldOfViewRH

        public static Matrix createPerspetiveFieldOfViewRH(float fov,
                                   float aspect,
                                   float zNear,
                                   float zFar)
        Create a perspective field of view matrix with Right hand notation.
        Parameters:
        fov - Desired field of view (Math.PI / 4 is a good value)
        aspect - Desired aspect ratio (Screen width / height)
        near - Near clip
        far - Far clip
        Returns:
        Return a matrix of this type of perspective.

      • createPerspectiveOffCenter

        public static Matrix createPerspectiveOffCenter(float left,
                                float right,
                                float bottom,
                                float top,
                                float zNear,
                                float zFar)
        Create a custom perspective matrix.
        Parameters:
        left - Minimum X value of the viewing volume.
        right - Maximum X value of the viewing volume.
        bottom - Minimum Y value of the viewing volume.
        top - Maximum Y value of the viewing volume.
        zNear - Minimum Z value of the viewing volume.
        zFar - Maximum Z value of the viewing volume.
        Returns:
        Return a new custom perspective matrix.
